events.text: January 11 - Turkey threatens Cyprus on account of a deal to buy Russian S-300 missiles, prompting the Cypriot Missile Crisis.[1]
events.html: January 11 - Turkey threatens Cyprus on account of a deal to buy Russian S-300 missiles, prompting the Cypriot Missile Crisis.[1]

events.text: January 17 – A Delta II rocket carrying a military GPS payload explodes, shortly after liftoff from Cape Canaveral.
events.html: January 17 – A Delta II rocket carrying a military GPS payload explodes, shortly after liftoff from Cape Canaveral.

events.text: January 18 – In northwest Rwanda, Hutu militia members kill 6 Spanish aid workers and three soldiers, and seriously wound another.
events.html: January 18 – In northwest Rwanda, Hutu militia members kill 6 Spanish aid workers and three soldiers, and seriously wound another.

events.text: January 19 – Yasser Arafat returns to Hebron after more than 30 years, and joins celebrations over the handover of the last Israeli-controlled West Bank city.[2]
events.html: January 19 – Yasser Arafat returns to Hebron after more than 30 years, and joins celebrations over the handover of the last Israeli-controlled West Bank city.[2]

events.text: January 20 – Bill Clinton is sworn in for a second term as President of the United States.
events.html: January 20 – Bill Clinton is sworn in for a second term as President of the United States.

events.text: January 23 – Madeleine Albright becomes the first female Secretary of State of the United States, after confirmation by the United States Senate.[3]
events.html: January 23 – Madeleine Albright becomes the first female Secretary of State of the United States, after confirmation by the United States Senate.[3]

events.text:
February 4
On their way to Lebanon, two Israeli troop-transport helicopters collide, killing all 73 on board.[4][5]
After at first contesting the results, Serbian President Slobodan Milošević recognizes opposition victories in the November 1996 elections.
A magnitude 6.5 earthquake strikes North Khorasan province, Iran, killing 88 people and injuring 1,948.[6]

  • A magnitude 6.5 earthquake strikes North Khorasan province, Iran, killing 88 people and injuring 1,948.[6]

events.text: February 10 – Sandline affair: Australian newspapers publish stories that the government of Papua New Guinea has brought mercenaries onto Bougainville Island.
events.html: February 10 – Sandline affair: Australian newspapers publish stories that the government of Papua New Guinea has brought mercenaries onto Bougainville Island.

events.text: February 13 – STS-82: Tune-up and repair work on the Hubble Space Telescope is started by astronauts from the Space Shuttle Discovery.[7]
events.html: February 13 – STS-82: Tune-up and repair work on the Hubble Space Telescope is started by astronauts from the Space Shuttle Discovery.[7]

events.text: February 28 – North Hollywood shootout: Two robbers, wearing kevlar body armor, and armed with AK-47s containing armor-piercing bullets, injure 17 police officers and civilians in a gun battle. The incident sparks debate on the appropriate firepower for United States patrol officers to have available in similar situations in the future.[relevant?]

events.text: March 4 – U.S. President Bill Clinton bans federal funding for any research on human cloning.
events.html: March 4 – U.S. President Bill Clinton bans federal funding for any research on human cloning.

events.text: March 7 – In Sri Lanka, the Tamil Tigers overrun a military base and kill over 100 Sri Lankan troops.
events.html: March 7 – In Sri Lanka, the Tamil Tigers overrun a military base and kill over 100 Sri Lankan troops.

events.text:
March 13
India's Missionaries of Charity chooses Sister Nirmala, to succeed Mother Teresa as its leader.
The National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China creates a new Chongqing Municipality, out of part of Sichuan.
events.html:
March 13
  • India's Missionaries of Charity chooses Sister Nirmala, to succeed Mother Teresa as its leader.

events.text: March 14 – A study of gender reassignment of a boy who lost his penis to a botched circumcision is exposed as fraudulent. The supposedly successful outcome had been widely cited as proof that gender was determined by nurture, yet the patient, David Reimer, was deeply unhappy and had returned to his original gender by the age of 15, thus indicating the opposite thesis.[8]
events.html: March 14 – A study of gender reassignment of a boy who lost his penis to a botched circumcision is exposed as fraudulent. The supposedly successful outcome had been widely cited as proof that gender was determined by nurture, yet the patient, David Reimer, was deeply unhappy and had returned to his original gender by the age of 15, thus indicating the opposite thesis.[8]

events.text: March 16 – Sandline affair: On Bougainville Island, soldiers of commander Jerry Singirok arrest Tim Spicer and his mercenaries of the Sandline International.
events.html: March 16 – Sandline affair: On Bougainville Island, soldiers of commander Jerry Singirok arrest Tim Spicer and his mercenaries of the Sandline International.

events.text: March 18 – The tail of a Russian An-24 charter plane breaks off while en route to Turkey, causing the plane to crash, killing all 50 on board, and resulting in the grounding of all An-24s.
events.html: March 18 – The tail of a Russian An-24 charter plane breaks off while en route to Turkey, causing the plane to crash, killing all 50 on board, and resulting in the grounding of all An-24s.

events.text: March 21 – In Zaire, Étienne Tshisekedi is appointed prime minister; he ejects supporters of Mobutu Sese Seko from his cabinet.
events.html: March 21 – In Zaire, Étienne Tshisekedi is appointed prime minister; he ejects supporters of Mobutu Sese Seko from his cabinet.

events.text: March 22 – The Comet Hale–Bopp makes its closest approach to Earth.
events.html: March 22 – The Comet Hale–Bopp makes its closest approach to Earth.

events.text: March 24 – The 69th Academy Awards, hosted by Billy Crystal, are held at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, with The English Patient winning Best Picture. During the event, the DVD format is launched in the United States.
events.html: March 24 – The 69th Academy Awards, hosted by Billy Crystal, are held at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, with The English Patient winning Best Picture. During the event, the DVD format is launched in the United States.

events.text: March 24 – 26 – In San Diego, 39 Heaven's Gate cultists commit mass suicide at their compound.
events.html: March 24 – 26 – In San Diego, 39 Heaven's Gate cultists commit mass suicide at their compound.

events.text: March 26 – Julius Chan resigns as prime minister of Papua New Guinea, effectively ending the Sandline affair.[9]
events.html: March 26 – Julius Chan resigns as prime minister of Papua New Guinea, effectively ending the Sandline affair.[9]

events.text: April 3 – The Thalit massacre in Algeria: all but 1 of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.
events.html: April 3 – The Thalit massacre in Algeria: all but 1 of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.

events.text:
April 14
Fire breaks out in a pilgrim camp on the Plain of Mena, 11 kilometres (6.8 mi) from Mecca; 343 die.
Former S.S. Captain Erich Priebke is retried; on July 22 he is sentenced to fifteen years in prison.[10]

events.html: April 21 – A Pegasus rocket carries the remains of 24 people into earth orbit, in the first space burial.

April 29
The Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW), CWC treaty enters into force.
Two trains crash at Hunan, China; 126 are killed.

events.text: May 1 - Tony Blair becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, as the Labour Party wins the 1997 United Kingdom general election and returns to government for the first time in 18 years.[11]
events.html: May 1 - Tony Blair becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, as the Labour Party wins the 1997 United Kingdom general election and returns to government for the first time in 18 years.[11]

events.text: May 3 – Katrina and the Waves win the Eurovision Song Contest 1997 for the United Kingdom with "Love Shine a Light".
events.html: May 3 – Katrina and the Waves win the Eurovision Song Contest 1997 for the United Kingdom with "Love Shine a Light".

events.text: May 9 – The first genetically modified three-parent baby is born.[12]
events.html: May 9 – The first genetically modified three-parent baby is born.[12]

events.text: May 10 – The 7.3 Mw  Qayen earthquake strikes eastern Iran with a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme). At least 1,567 were killed and 2,300 were injured.
events.html: May 10 – The 7.3 Mw  Qayen earthquake strikes eastern Iran with a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme). At least 1,567 were killed and 2,300 were injured.

events.text: May 11 – IBM's Deep Blue defeats Garry Kasparov in the last game of the rematch, the first time a computer beats a chess World champion in a match.
events.html: May 11 – IBM's Deep Blue defeats Garry Kasparov in the last game of the rematch, the first time a computer beats a chess World champion in a match.

events.text:
May 12
The Russian–Chechen Peace Treaty is signed.
An F1-rated tornado strikes downtown Miami, causing $525,000 in damages. Pictures and videos of this tornado made news headlines around the world.
events.html:
May 12
  • The Russian–Chechen Peace Treaty is signed.
  • An F1-rated tornado strikes downtown Miami, causing $525,000 in damages. Pictures and videos of this tornado made news headlines around the world.

events.text: May 15 – The United States government acknowledges existence of the "Secret War" in Laos (1953–1975) during the Vietnam War, and dedicates the Laos Memorial in honor of Hmong and other "Secret War" veterans.
events.html: May 15 – The United States government acknowledges existence of the "Secret War" in Laos (1953–1975) during the Vietnam War, and dedicates the Laos Memorial in honor of Hmong and other "Secret War" veterans.

events.text:
May 16
President Mobutu Sese Seko is exiled from Zaire.
U.S. President Bill Clinton issues a formal apology to the surviving victims of the Tuskegee Study of Untreated Syphilis in the Negro Male and their families.

May 16

events.html: May 27 – The second-deadliest tornado of the 1990s hits in Jarrell, Texas, killing 27 people.

events.text: May 31 – The 13-kilometer Confederation Bridge, the world's longest bridge spanning ice-covered waters, opens between Prince Edward Island and New Brunswick, Canada.
events.html: May 31 – The 13-kilometer Confederation Bridge, the world's longest bridge spanning ice-covered waters, opens between Prince Edward Island and New Brunswick, Canada.

events.text:
June 1
Socialist Party-led Centre-left coalition won the second-round in 1997 French legislative elections, began with the third Cohabitation (1997–2002).
Hugo Banzer wins the Presidential elections in Bolivia.

June 1

events.text: June 2 – In Denver, Colorado, Timothy McVeigh is convicted on 15 counts of murder and conspiracy for his role in the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing.
events.html: June 2 – In Denver, Colorado, Timothy McVeigh is convicted on 15 counts of murder and conspiracy for his role in the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing.

events.text: June 10 – Khmer Rouge leader Pol Pot orders the killing of his defense chief, Son Sen, and 11 of Sen's family members, before Pol Pot flees his northern stronghold.
events.html: June 10 – Khmer Rouge leader Pol Pot orders the killing of his defense chief, Son Sen, and 11 of Sen's family members, before Pol Pot flees his northern stronghold.

events.text: June 11 – In the United Kingdom, the House of Commons votes for a total ban on handguns.
events.html: June 11 – In the United Kingdom, the House of Commons votes for a total ban on handguns.

events.text: June 13 – A jury sentences Timothy McVeigh to death for his part in the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing.
events.html: June 13 – A jury sentences Timothy McVeigh to death for his part in the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing.

events.html: June 16 – About 50 people are killed in the Daïat Labguer (M'sila) massacre in Algeria.

events.text:
June 25
A massive eruption of the Soufrière Hills volcano on the island of Montserrat leads to evacuation and eventual abandonment of the capital, Plymouth.
An unmanned Progress spacecraft collides with the Russian space station Mir.

June 25
  • A massive eruption of the Soufrière Hills volcano on the island of Montserrat leads to evacuation and eventual abandonment of the capital, Plymouth.

events.text: June 26 – Bertie Ahern is appointed as the 10th Taoiseach of the Republic of Ireland and Mary Harney is appointed as the 16th, and first female, Tánaiste, after their parties, Fianna Fáil and the Progressive Democrats respectively, win the 1997 General Election.

events.html: July 4 – NASA's Pathfinder space probe lands on the surface of Mars.

In Cambodia, Hun Sen of the Cambodian People's Party overthrows Norodom Ranariddh in a coup.
The Egyptian Islamic Group announces a cessation-of-violence initiative.

events.html: July 11 – Thailand's worst hotel fire at Pattaya kills 90.

events.text: July 27 – About 50 are killed in the Si Zerrouk massacre in Algeria.

events.text: August 3 – 11 – Two of the three islands of the Union of the Comoros – Anjouan and Mohéli – attempt to revert to colonial rule by France. The plan fails when the French government of President Jacques Chirac refuses to recolonize them resulting in the two islands being reintegrated into the Comoros over the next two years.

  • Al-Qaeda carries out a terrorist attack in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

events.html: Wales votes in favour of devolution and the formation of a National Assembly for Wales.

events.text: Al-Qaeda carries out a terrorist attack in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
events.html: Al-Qaeda carries out a terrorist attack in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

events.text: September 19 – 53 are killed in the Guelb El-Kebir massacre in Algeria.
events.html: September 19 – 53 are killed in the Guelb El-Kebir massacre in Algeria.

events.text:
September 21
The Islamic Salvation Army, the Islamic Salvation Fronts' armed wing, declares a unilateral ceasefire in Algeria.
St. Olaf's Church, a stone church from the 16th century in Tyrvää, Finland, is burnt down.[16]
events.html:
September 21
  • The Islamic Salvation Army, the Islamic Salvation Fronts' armed wing, declares a unilateral ceasefire in Algeria.
  • St. Olaf's Church, a stone church from the 16th century in Tyrvää, Finland, is burnt down.[16]

events.text: The Islamic Salvation Army, the Islamic Salvation Fronts' armed wing, declares a unilateral ceasefire in Algeria.

events.text: St. Olaf's Church, a stone church from the 16th century in Tyrvää, Finland, is burnt down.[16]
events.html: St. Olaf's Church, a stone church from the 16th century in Tyrvää, Finland, is burnt down.[16]

events.text: September 25 – Iraq disarmament crisis: UNSCOM inspector Dr. Diane Seaman catches several Iraqi men sneaking out the back door of an inspection site, with log books for the creation of prohibited bacteria and chemicals.
events.html: September 25 – Iraq disarmament crisis: UNSCOM inspector Dr. Diane Seaman catches several Iraqi men sneaking out the back door of an inspection site, with log books for the creation of prohibited bacteria and chemicals.

events.text:
September 26
Garuda Indonesia Flight 152 crashes while on approach to Medan, North Sumatra, during the 1997 Southeast Asian haze, killing all 234 people on board. This becomes the deadliest aviation accident in Indonesian history.
An earthquake strikes the Italian regions of Umbria and Marche, causing part of the Basilica of St. Francis at Assisi to collapse.
events.html:
September 26
  • Garuda Indonesia Flight 152 crashes while on approach to Medan, North Sumatra, during the 1997 Southeast Asian haze, killing all 234 people on board. This becomes the deadliest aviation accident in Indonesian history.
  • An earthquake strikes the Italian regions of Umbria and Marche, causing part of the Basilica of St. Francis at Assisi to collapse.

events.html: An earthquake strikes the Italian regions of Umbria and Marche, causing part of the Basilica of St. Francis at Assisi to collapse.

events.text: October 2 – British scientists Moira Bruce and John Collinge, with their colleagues, independently show that the new variant form of the Creutzfeldt–Jakob disease is the same disease as Bovine spongiform encephalopathy.
events.html: October 2 – British scientists Moira Bruce and John Collinge, with their colleagues, independently show that the new variant form of the Creutzfeldt–Jakob disease is the same disease as Bovine spongiform encephalopathy.

events.text: October 3 – President of Paraguay, Juan Carlos Wasmosy, orders the arrest of political opponent Lino Oviedo.
events.html: October 3 – President of Paraguay, Juan Carlos Wasmosy, orders the arrest of political opponent Lino Oviedo.

events.text: October 4 – Loomis Fargo Bank Robbery: The second largest cash robbery in U.S. history ($17.3 million, mostly in small bills) occurs at the Charlotte, North Carolina office of Wells Fargo. An FBI investigation eventually results in 24 convictions and the recovery of approximately 95% of the stolen cash.
events.html: October 4 – Loomis Fargo Bank Robbery: The second largest cash robbery in U.S. history ($17.3 million, mostly in small bills) occurs at the Charlotte, North Carolina office of Wells Fargo. An FBI investigation eventually results in 24 convictions and the recovery of approximately 95% of the stolen cash.

events.text: October 12 – Sidi Daoud massacre: 43 are killed at a false roadblock in Algeria.
events.html: October 12 – Sidi Daoud massacre: 43 are killed at a false roadblock in Algeria.

events.text:
October 15
Andy Green sets the first supersonic land speed record for the ThrustSSC team, led by Richard Noble of the UK. ThrustSSC goes through the flying mile course at Black Rock Desert, Nevada at an average speed of 1,227.985 km/h (763.035 mph).
NASA launches the Cassini–Huygens probe to Saturn.
events.html:
October 15
  • Andy Green sets the first supersonic land speed record for the ThrustSSC team, led by Richard Noble of the UK. ThrustSSC goes through the flying mile course at Black Rock Desert, Nevada at an average speed of 1,227.985 km/h (763.035 mph).
  • NASA launches the Cassini–Huygens probe to Saturn.

events.text: Andy Green sets the first supersonic land speed record for the ThrustSSC team, led by Richard Noble of the UK. ThrustSSC goes through the flying mile course at Black Rock Desert, Nevada at an average speed of 1,227.985 km/h (763.035 mph).

events.text: NASA launches the Cassini–Huygens probe to Saturn.
events.html: NASA launches the Cassini–Huygens probe to Saturn.

events.text: October 16 – The first color photograph appears on the front page of The New York Times.
events.html: October 16 – The first color photograph appears on the front page of The New York Times.

events.text: October 17 – The remains of Che Guevara are laid to rest with full military honours in a specially built mausoleum in the city of Santa Clara, Cuba, where he had won the decisive battle of the Cuban Revolution 39 years before.
events.html: October 17 – The remains of Che Guevara are laid to rest with full military honours in a specially built mausoleum in the city of Santa Clara, Cuba, where he had won the decisive battle of the Cuban Revolution 39 years before.

events.text: October 22 – Danish escaped criminal Steen Christensen robs the Hotel Palace in Helsinki, Finland, killing two police officers while evading capture.[17][18]
events.html: October 22 – Danish escaped criminal Steen Christensen robs the Hotel Palace in Helsinki, Finland, killing two police officers while evading capture.[17][18]

events.text: October 29 – Iraq disarmament crisis: Iraq says it will begin shooting down Lockheed U-2 surveillance planes being used by UNSCOM inspectors.
events.html: October 29 – Iraq disarmament crisis: Iraq says it will begin shooting down Lockheed U-2 surveillance planes being used by UNSCOM inspectors.

events.text: November 11 – Telecom companies WorldCom and MCI Communications announce a US$37 billion merger to form MCI WorldCom, the largest merger in U.S. history.
events.html: November 11 – Telecom companies WorldCom and MCI Communications announce a US$37 billion merger to form MCI WorldCom, the largest merger in U.S. history.

events.text: November 12 – Mary McAleese is elected the eighth President of Ireland in succession to Mary Robinson, the first time in the world that one woman has succeeded another as elected head of state.
events.html: November 12 – Mary McAleese is elected the eighth President of Ireland in succession to Mary Robinson, the first time in the world that one woman has succeeded another as elected head of state.

events.text: November 13 – Ramzi Yousef is found guilty of masterminding the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.
events.html: November 13 – Ramzi Yousef is found guilty of masterminding the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.

events.text: November 17 – In Luxor, Egypt, 62 people are killed by 6 Islamic militants outside the Temple of Hatshepsut.
events.html: November 17 – In Luxor, Egypt, 62 people are killed by 6 Islamic militants outside the Temple of Hatshepsut.

events.text: November 19 – In Des Moines, Iowa, Bobbi McCaughey gives birth to septuplets in the second known case where all seven babies are born alive, and the first in which all survive infancy.
events.html: November 19 – In Des Moines, Iowa, Bobbi McCaughey gives birth to septuplets in the second known case where all seven babies are born alive, and the first in which all survive infancy.

events.text: November 27 – NASA's Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission is launched, the start of the satellite component of the Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System.
events.html: November 27 – NASA's Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission is launched, the start of the satellite component of the Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System.

events.text: December 1 – In the Indian state of Bihar, Ranvir Sena attacks the CPI(ML) Party Unity stronghold Lakshmanpur-Bathe, killing 63 lower caste people.
events.html: December 1 – In the Indian state of Bihar, Ranvir Sena attacks the CPI(ML) Party Unity stronghold Lakshmanpur-Bathe, killing 63 lower caste people.

events.text: December 3 – In Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, representatives from 121 countries sign a treaty prohibiting the manufacture and deployment of anti-personnel land mines. However, the United States, the People's Republic of China, Russia, South Korea and 32 other nations do not sign and/or ratify the treaty.
events.html: December 3 – In Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, representatives from 121 countries sign a treaty prohibiting the manufacture and deployment of anti-personnel land mines. However, the United States, the People's Republic of China, Russia, South Korea and 32 other nations do not sign and/or ratify the treaty.

events.text: December 10 – The capital of Kazakhstan is moved from Almaty to Astana.
events.html: December 10 – The capital of Kazakhstan is moved from Almaty to Astana.

events.text: December 11 – The Kyoto Protocol is adopted by a United Nations committee.
events.html: December 11 – The Kyoto Protocol is adopted by a United Nations committee.

events.text: December 16 – In Japan, over 700 children suffer epilectic attacks due to an episode of the anime Pokémon.
events.html: December 16 – In Japan, over 700 children suffer epilectic attacks due to an episode of the anime Pokémon.

events.text: December 18 – In Australia, 20th Century Fox releases a feature-length film about a children's group named The Wiggles called The Wiggles Movie.
events.html: December 18 – In Australia, 20th Century Fox releases a feature-length film about a children's group named The Wiggles called The Wiggles Movie.

events.text:
December 19
Janet Jagan (widow of Cheddi Jagan) takes office in Guyana.
James Cameron's Titanic, the then highest-grossing film of all time, premieres in the U.S.
SilkAir Flight 185 crashes into the Musi River, near Palembang in Indonesia, killing 104.

  • James Cameron's Titanic, the then highest-grossing film of all time, premieres in the U.S.
  • SilkAir Flight 185 crashes into the Musi River, near Palembang in Indonesia, killing 104.

events.text: December 21 – Brazil beats Australia 6–0 in the Confederations Cup final.
events.html: December 21 – Brazil beats Australia 6–0 in the Confederations Cup final.

events.text: December 24 – 50–100 villagers are killed in the Sid El-Antri massacre in Algeria.
events.html: December 24 – 50–100 villagers are killed in the Sid El-Antri massacre in Algeria.

events.text: December 27 – Ulster loyalist paramilitary leader Billy Wright is assassinated in Northern Ireland, inside Long Kesh prison.
events.html: December 27 – Ulster loyalist paramilitary leader Billy Wright is assassinated in Northern Ireland, inside Long Kesh prison.

events.text: December 29 – Hong Kong begins to kill all the chickens within its territory (1.25 million) to stop the spread of a potentially deadly influenza strain.
events.html: December 29 – Hong Kong begins to kill all the chickens within its territory (1.25 million) to stop the spread of a potentially deadly influenza strain.

events.text: December 30 – Wilaya of Relizane massacres of December 30, 1997: In the worst incident in Algeria's insurgency, 400 are killed from four villages in the wilaya of Relizane.
events.html: December 30 – Wilaya of Relizane massacres of December 30, 1997: In the worst incident in Algeria's insurgency, 400 are killed from four villages in the wilaya of Relizane.

events.text: The Toyota Prius, the first hybrid vehicle to go into full production, is unveiled in Japan on October 24, and goes on sale in Japan on December 9. It comes to U.S. showrooms on July 11, 2000.[20]
